questions.text: One of the most famous American paintings is 'An American Gothic'. Who is the painter?
questions.explanation:
Grant Wood.

	It's considered a classic - I'm not sure why.

questions.text: Who wrote the familiar poem that is inscribed at the Statue of Liberty?
questions.explanation:
Emma Lazarus.

	'Give me your tired, your poor ...'

questions.text: 'Dixie' is a classic American song. Who is the composer?
questions.explanation:
Daniel Decatur Emmett.

	Howe wrote the 'Battle Hymn of the Republic'.

questions.text: Bruce Catton, Shelby Foote and Allen Nevins are all historians who have written extensively about what period in American History?
'The Death of Wolfe' is a famous painting that has significance for American History. Who is the painter?
questions.explanation:
Benjamin West.

	A scene from the French and Indian (or Seven Years') War.

questions.text: Who made the observation that there are men of principle in every political party, but there are no parties of principle?
questions.explanation:
Alexis De Tocqueville.

	'Democracy in America'. Early observations on the new American system of government. He was right.

questions.text: Who wrote that the precious right of free speech does not extend to yelling 'fire' in a crowded movie theater?
questions.explanation:
Oliver Wendell Holmes.

	Writing for the U.S. Supreme Court.

questions.text: What song includes these lyrics: 'Then conquer we must, When our cause, it is just, And this be our motto: 'In God is our trust'?
questions.explanation:
Star Spangled Banner.

	There is more than one verse to the 'Banner' - although the first verse is the one that is commonly remembered and sung.

questions.text: Who said 'Ask not what your country can do for you ... ask what you can do for your country' in his inaugural address?
questions.explanation:
John Kennedy.

	Perhaps his most famous line.

questions.text: Lewis and Clark opened the doors to the American West, but the taming of the west involved conflicts with American Indians. Which future president fought in the Blackhawk War?
questions.explanation:
Abraham Lincoln.

	Zachary Taylor and Jefferson Davis, too. Lewis died under mysterious circumstances: suicide or murder? Indian resistance ended essentially with the massacre at Wounded Knee.
